Summary: A very clean hotel hood location about 15 minute walk to Disneyland would have wanted the pool a little warmer. Room was nice quiet annd clean. Complimentary breakfast worked well for anre family. Overall would recommend.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review and thank you for choosing to stay with us.

Summary Heading: The BEST hotel for Disney families!!!
Summary: This hotel is fantastic for Disney families. It’s brand new and absolutely gorgeous. The breakfast that starts at 6:30am is included with the stay is sooo convenient when you are with young kids. It has the full spread with anything a kid would want (yogurt, cereal, waffles, bagels, muffins), and this morning it included omelettes and an oatmeal bar. I was happy to be able to eat healthy before a big Disney day. So appreciated and it’s clear the staff are working so hard to keep everything spotless everywhere at the resort. The staff is also very customer oriented all around. They have all been outstandingly pleasant, especially Chez, the guy on evening duty every time I come. This time he offered me extra masks so I wouldn’t have to go get them from the car, but other times he
Room tip: request a high room with view of fireworks.

Summary: The service we received was top notch, which included the valet, the ladies working in the buffet and housekeeping. Everything was clean and we liked that nobody came to our room to clean unless we requested it. The room was so spacious and loved having the kitchen as an option for when we wanting to make things for the family. We would 100% stay here again and recommend it to everyone we know.
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear you enjoyed your recent stay at the Home2 Suites Anaheim Resort. Thank you for the wonderful review and thank you for choosing to stay with us.

Summary: The hotel was clean and the staff pleasant, but this hotel gets almost everything else wrong.  The "1 Queen 2 Bedroom Suite" (which is actually a room with two bedrooms, each with a queen bed where both bedrooms share the single bathroom), was very ODD.   One bedroom had a single window that opened NOT to the outside, but to the second bedroom.  The second bedroom had windows on three walls; one set of windows overlooked the highway, one set overlooked the living area, and one set overlooked the other bedroom.  Every small detail was incorrect; no hot water in the bathroom sink (reported to maintenance but unresolved), no towel hooks in the bathroom, fridge that opened the wrong way.  Decor was industrial-strength sterile.  The 5 freeway is adjacent to the hotel, and the hotel
Manager Response: We sincerely apologize your stay was less than satisfactory and you did not enjoy the layout of our family suite.  We appreciate your honest feedback as we take all guest comments into consideration when making changes.  Thank you again for your candid feedback and thank you for choosing to stay with us.

Summary: This is a great hotel for Disneyland visitors. Less than 10 minute walk. Our room was in great condition and clean. Breakfast was good, with sufficient options. We only stayed 3 nights, so no housekeeping service. Parking is expensive, with valet as the only option. WiFi is not free, unless you are an Honors member. Overall, a good stay.
Manager Response: We are pleased to hear you enjoyed your recent stay at the Home2 Suites Anaheim Resort.  Thank you for taking the time to share a review and thank you for choosing to stay with us.

Summary Heading: Good, but has some bad engineering choices in the room.
Summary: This is a solid 4 star hotel, there are definitely some engineering mistakes in the room, but the location, staff and service was good. Can’t fault the staff for bad management choices.  Pros:  -It is an 8-10 min walk to security at Disneyland  -Room was clean and comfortable  -If you are lucky enough to get a room with a view of the park you can see the fireworks out the window  -lots of storage space, which we really needed since the room was smaller than it looked. We were able to unpack everything and use the drawers.  -coffee shop, bar and restaurant are awesome -We didn’t use the pool due to the cold weather, but it looked awesome.  -Valet was expensive, but no more than anywhere else nearby and getting in and out was very quick.  -The Kitchen is tiny, but was well stocked
Manager Response: Thank you for your thorough review.  We always appreciate all guest feedback and always strive to make improvements where needed.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us.

Summary: Easy walk to Disney from the hotel. Very clean and new. Quiet rooms, even near elevator. Valet parking is worth it. Breakfast was similar to Hampton Inn, we are a family of 6 and they have rooms that hold up to 6, a great value, much less expensive than getting two rooms.
Manager Response: We are excited to hear you enjoyed your recent stay. Thank you for the wonderful review and thank you for staying with us.

Summary: Had interconnecting rooms for 6 of us. 4 queens, 2 sofa beds, 2 full bathrooms. 2 kitchens. Loved everything. Free breakfast is convenient. Laundry is great. Kids liked the pool and spa. 8 min walk to Disneyland. Walked to garden walk and other restaurants too. Highly recommend for families.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful recommendation. We are pleased to hear you found our hotel to be perfect for your Disney family getaway and thank you for choosing to stay us.

Summary: I love the place and proximity to Disney Breakfast was a little bit monotonous, but that was expected. I just wish they clean daily and not by request.this was disappointing especially i had foreign guests
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear you enjoyed your recent stay. Thank you for staying with us.

Summary: Our family of four stayed here for four nights while attending Disney for three days.  The family room had lots of space and was well set out as a long room.  It was clean and the air conditioning worked well during our stay.  Breakfast was standard American sugar packaged in different ways.   It is a short easy 10 to 15 walk to the entrance of Disney.  Standard solid Hilton hotel in the USA that was good value.  I would recommend to anyone visiting Disney and want a bit of space for the whole family to crash at night.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recommendation of the Home2 Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort.  We are delighted to hear you enjoyed your recent Disney stay and thank you for choosing to stay with us.

Summary: This was my second time staying at the hotel.  I was lucky enough to have Anaya check me in again.  She is the most bright eyed, sweet and helpful employee at the hotel.  I would say the customer service from everybody else was also a positive experience.  The only reason I didn’t give a rating of five is that both visits the room above me had occupants that sounded like wild animals running around. I don’t know if I am just unlucky or the engineering of the hotel is really bad.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words in regards to service received from our hotel team members.  We apologize you experienced noise during your past two visits with us.  Please reach out to us the next time you plan on visiting so we may be able to select a top floor location for you.  Thank you for staying with us.

Summary Heading: Worst Parking Situation with Valet without a spare key
Summary: Arrived at 9:30pm with kids, since I did not bring a spare key card from my tesla, I asked if I can park myself and still pay the valet fee, I was told by the hotel to park a mile away and walk back to the hotel due to I don't have a spare key and valet can not valet my car, I had to park a mile away and walk with 2 kids back to the hotel.  Your whole purpose is to bring convenience to your guests with valet, not inconvenience added for your guests if a spare key is not presented since it wasn't a requirement, needless to say, I will not be staying at this hotel ever again with hotel staff asked you go park in a public parking a mile away and walk a mile back to the hotel.
Manager Response: We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience experienced with our hotel valet parking.  Valet parking is the only option at our hotel  for guests and it is required for guests to leave their keys with the valet service.  We apologize your stay was less than satisfactory and again apologize we were not able to accommodate your vehicle due to vehicle key not being present.

Summary: My 2 daughters, 3 grandkids, and I stayed here to visit Disneyland. GREAT location (easy and close walk to the parks and Downtown Disney), EXTENSIVE and delicious buffet breakfast, LARGE room, COMFY beds, ATTENTIVE staff. We will be back here!
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear you had a fantastic stay at the Home2 Suites Anaheim Resort and truly appreciate your wonderful review.  We thank you for choosing to stay with us and look forward to seeing you back again soon.

Summary: this is definitely not a budget friendly hotel. That being said … we were happy with the design of the room. It works well for our family.  Unfortunately it was not ready until hours past our check-in time. Our daughter was very frustrated. Tired. Overstimulated. It made for a very long evening that we had to wait hours extra hours for our room… on top of our travel time. Parking is extremely expensive. More expensive than the nearby theme park. The price of parking & the cost of the rooms couldn’t justify sitting in the lobby with kids for hours or waiting on blankets & pillows til after 10 pm. You can find a nearby hotel with parking and rooms half the cost.. Food was terrible. Only half of the hotel building receives complementary breakfast? That’s also misleading & confusing.
Manager Response: We sincerely apologize your stay with us was less than satisfactory and thank you for your honest feedback. We value all guest feedback and always strive to make improvements where necessary.  Thank you for staying with us.

Summary: Best stay of my life.  The staff was wonderful and the rooms were great.  New property with all the amenities.  Also only minutes away from Disneyland.  Chez, Jules, and the whole staff were great.  Will return soon to this property.
Manager Response: We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed your recent stay at the Home2 Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort. Thank you for the wonderful review and thank you for choosing to stay with us.  We look forward to seeing you back again in the future.

Summary Heading: Within walking distance of Disney & great pool/hot tub
Summary: We stayed there 2 nights this October. Hotel is quiet, room was spacious and comfy with well-equipped and handy kitchenette. Breakfast (included) was so-so. Staff was very helpful and the best part was that we could walk down to Disneyland. Overall, a practical choice for Disney. We might forego the free breakfast and do the a la carte the next time. If you need to make it to LAX after your stay, Uber seems to be the best option, and the HOV lanes on the highways really help keep the fare down.
Manager Response: We are pleased to hear you enjoyed our close proximity to the Disney theme parks and our spacious outdoor pool area at the Home2 Suites Anaheim Resort.  Thank you for the review and thank you for staying with us.

Summary Heading: Has all amenities needed, including bar and restaurant
Summary: My family and I decided to visit Disneyland for 1st time in over a decade. My twins just turned 21, so having a restaurant and Bar in hotel was so convenient to celebrate. I would definitely recommend.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful recommendation and thank you for your review.  We are delighted you enjoyed your recent stay with us and hope to see you back again in the future.

Summary Heading: Poor housekeeping managerFalse charges incured on bill
Summary: We stayed at Home 2 Suites in Anaheim. CA for the first time. We checked in on 3/3 and checked out on 3/6. We planned this stay through a Disney planner. The bathrooms do not lock and they are closed with sliding doors instead of a regular door. Which is not ideal if your staying with kids as majority of the time that is the case. You can tell Housekeeping is poor because when we pulled out the bed we found other peoples trash and receipts  stuffed in the couch. There were spots that could be easily wiped upon the counters that they missed. And the water that comes out bathroom sink smelled strongly of recycled sewer water, it had a strong poop smell that i didnt feel it was ok to even brush your teeth with so we brought out own water bottles. Valet is expensive. I found out the
Manager Response: We apologize for any inconvenience or dismay experienced due to our non-smoking policy, however we do take smoking violations seriously and do charge all guests who violate our smoking policy.  Our guestrooms are 100% non smoking and the charge will remain as posted.

Summary: One of my worst stay in Hilton properties. I have problem with my check-in as the room I reserved thru Hilton email was gone and they claimed they don’t honor those reservation. The breakfast was bad. They charged you with wrong descriptions and when I asked the front desk about those charges they claimed that it means differently from what the billing stated. So hard just to get simple towels or toilet paper. We have to ask everyday onlythru front desk and we have to wait.
Manager Response: We sincerely apologize for any inconveniences experienced during your recent stay with us.  Unfortunately, due to the smaller size of our hotel property and our daily high occupancy, we are sometimes not able to confirm pre-selected rooms from the Honors application, however we do try our best to place guests in a comparable room and location.  Thank you for sharing your valuable feedback as we always strive to make improvements to our guests' experience where needed.

Summary: As someone who does not enjoy staying in hotels (because they often feel dirty/ old) I loved my stay here. I was travelling without my husband and wanted to be somewhere walking distance to Disneyland as I was travelling with my son. It’s about a 10 minute walk; there are a few closer resorts but it’s certainly close enough.   Overall the hotel feels new and clean. Staff were helpful. My only complaint was the morning we left (very early) the shower would not get hot after several minutes. Eventually it did heat up but took a good 5 minutes. Also the wine/ snacks in lobby are very expensive.   The room was super comfortable and felt clean. Even facing the freeway it was quiet and nice and dark to sleep in. The pool area was great for kids and we were satisfied with breakfast. I
Manager Response: Thank you for your thorough review of the Home2 Suites Anaheim Resort.  We are delighted to hear you found our rooms to comfortable and clean and enjoyed our hotel amenities during your recent stay.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and we hope to see you back again in the future.

Summary: The staff are very nice and helpful, only a short walk to the parks and overall I enjoyed my stay however I did encounter some issues.  The floors are very thin. I had a family above me who’s kids where running back and forth and it was so loud that it woke me every morning.  There are only blinds over the window that let a lot of light in the morning so is hard to rest once the sun is up.  There is no access to streaming services via chromecast etc even though when I booked this was advertised.  Room was ok, but for a new hotel it loos like it’s already having issues with masking tape in the corridor holding the edges of the walls together and lots of dings to the furniture in the room.
Manager Response: We sincerely apologize for falling below expectations and appreciate your honest feedback, as we take all guest feedback seriously and always strive to make improvements where needed.  Thank you for taking the time to share your guest experience and thank you for choosing to stay with us.

Summary Heading: Great stay even seen the fireworks
Summary: Great size rooms there was only 2 of us but plenty space for a family , easy to walk to the parks we heard and seen some of the fireworks from our room great breakfast in the morning with plenty of choice
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review of the Home2 Suites Anaheim Resort.  We are pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay with us and hope to see you back again in the future. Thank you for staying with us.

Summary: Staff was very helpful. The room was ready early and well stocked. Nice size fridge and microwave. Plates, utensils all there and ready to use. The morning breakfast was an unexpected treat. Very walkable and safe to the Disneyland property.

Summary Heading: Clean family hotel near Disney... big rooms!
Summary: I checked in early as a Hilton Honors member using the app, and picked my room. When we arrived at the hotel I was given a different room and had to go back to the front desk to address this.  Very disappointing - what is the point of checking in and reserving your room if you don't get it....  That being said, the front desk staff was friendly and they did help me out.  Loved that the room was generously sized, including a dishwasher, sink and full sized fridge.  Rooms were clean and beds comfortable, which was nice after a long day at the parks.  Great pillows! The bathroom door was a barn style sliding door and does NOT provide for complete privacy.  We stayed 3 nights, and housekeeping was only offered by request.   The hotel was right next to the freeway but I did not hear

We got in and was greeted by a very friendly valet. I was able to obtain a digital entry key to our room. Room was ready early. Got into a nice size room and very t clean room.  Conveniently walking distance to Disneyland. Complementary breakfast, clean gym, and a nice size pool. We’ll be back for sure!

This hotel was so convenient to Disneyland. It was less than a mile walk from the hotel to the Disney park entrances. Many families even with very young children were walking to the park each day. The hotel was nicely decorated and beds and the fold out couch were comfortable. We didn’t use the pool but it looked very nice. There were plenty of breakfast options and the dining area was nice. Our requests for new towels was always completed immediately. We would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review of the Home2 Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort.  We are pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay with us and look forward to seeing you back again soon.

Summary: Overall the hotel was clean, staff was kind and attentive. It was an easy walk to Disney as well. We would stay again, although we do have a few complaints.  Breakfast was just ok, it was extremely minimal. No disposable coffee cups were available (which is a big deal since we are big coffee drinkers) and you can’t take any of the food back with you to eat instead of eating in the tiny, crowded at times, dining area. Our biggest complaint was MANDATORY valet parking that was not disclosed in advance. With small kids, multiple forgotten items happen and it was a huge hassle anytime we needed to retrieve an item from our car. We spent a good bit more in tips thanks to this unpleasant surprise as well.

From the time I check in to the time I check out was a horrible experience.  When I check in the front desk lady had the attitude of my way or the highway, and was very unpleasant to work with.   I asked for a blanket for my pullout couch the first night I was there and got a blanket with holes in it. I repeatedly asked for a blanket over the next two days including the front desk, house keeping and other staff members. A family Member had to go down and demand a new blanket to replace my blanket with huge holes in it.   House keeping came by to service my room on day one, after I was told my the front desk they only service rooms every 3 days. I asked for towels and another blanket, they told me they would be back with the stuff I needed and never returned.   Day two they came

Enjoyed our week stay at the hotel. Walkable to Disney park. Enjoyed fireworks from the room. Plenty of options at the breakfast. Service at vallet parking was exceptional and quick. Overall, we had a very good experience here and will more than likely return
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the wonderful review of the Home2 Suites Anaheim Resort.  We are pleased to hear you enjoyed your recent stay.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us.

Summary: We loved this hotel. It’s so great for families. The beds are insanely comfortable. The staff is so nice and helpful. The breakfast is good - not a huge selection but still really good.  Down the block from Disney (my kids never complained about the walk and that’s saying something:-) highly recommended.  We would totally stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your wonderful hotel recommendation of the Home2 Suites Anaheim Resort.  We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed your recent stay and look forward to seeing you back again in the future.

Summary Heading: Disneyland trip for family of 4 plus grands
Summary: We really enjoyed this hotel. Beware though....sometimes you can book a two bedroom suite on the site but at the time of our travels (mid-april) these suites were not finished. They made sure to take care of us and putting us in connecting 2 queen suites for the same price So much room! It was nice to have a full size fridge for a full week stay. We received two housekeeping days which was fine. Breakfast was on par with other hotel breakfast some muffins or pastries would have been nice or a meat other than sausage, but the breakfast is not why we booked this hotel. The walk to the park was not bad at all. My biggest complaint was the required valet parking at $30 a night. I understand it is somewhat usual for all the hotels in the area so there is that. Overall would
Manager Response: Thank you for your candid review of the Home2 Suites Anaheim Resort.  We are pleased to hear you enjoyed the spaciousness of our guestrooms and our conveniently close distance to the Disney theme parks.  Thank you for staying with us and we look forward to welcoming you back in the future.

Summary: Disney with the family and Grandkids  Our hotel stay was amazing just a 10 mi walk to the gates of Disney the fireworks fully visible from our room Great service and accommodation all around I normally stay at a Disney hotel but most likely will return here
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear you had an amazing stay at the Home2 Suites Anaheim Resort and enjoyed our guestroom accommodations and service.  Thank you for the wonderful review and thank you for choosing to stay with us.

Summary: This is a very nice and clean hotel.  Staff was helpful and listening.  The daily complimentary breakfast was nice, but was pretty much the same items daily (eggs, sausage, waffles, oatmeal, bread\bagel).  I’m not complaining about it, but it’s not as great as some of my other free breakfast experiences. The valet staff is friendly, but when calling ahead for our vehicle, it was hit or miss in getting in touch with them.  As a result, I always added another 20-30 minutes to planning to retrieve the car.  The housekeeping only came by once during our 5 night stay and did came around 4 pm when my family had already returned from a full morning in Disneyland. I wish they would come earlier so it did not disturb our afternoon naps.  The swimming pool was adequate as well as the
Manager Response: Thank you for your thorough review of the Home2 Suites Anaheim Resort.  We sincerely appreciate all guests' comments and suggestions, as we always strive to make improvements to enhance the guest experience.  Thank you for staying with us and we hope to see you back again in the future.

Summary Heading: Good stay at Home2 near Disneyland in early April 2022
Summary: Mostly good experience at Home2 in early April. Spent 7 nights and only got 1 full housekeeping service. Which is not ideal. Though anytime we requested something like towels or a sewing kit the front desk was quick to provide, if we picked it up from there. I would love to see daily service just to remove garbage and leave coffee and such, leave the bed making and towel replacements to every 3 days if they must.   Other cons include: the barn doors on the bathrooms are a poor choice (1 inch gap means someone at the door can see whoever’s at the toilet/sink!) and I recommend some kind of fix, low shower pressure in our room (328), the lighting around the mirror is not very bright and the breakfast has basically no variety from day to day (with the exception of scrambled eggs vs
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear you had a good stay at the Home2 Suites Anaheim Resort.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and we hope to see you back again soon.

Summary: the location was within walking distance to Disneyland.  We were able to watch the fireworks from our room #428.  Very nice since we avoided the crowds jockying for position in front of the castle.  The free breakfast was o.k.

Enjoyed the trip place was clean and Employees were very nice and helpful.  About a 20 min walk to Disneyland . Breakfast was good and served on time . Only complaint is I wish the hot tub is open later. For adults after walking all day at Disneyland

The hotel, rooms, and staff are very nice. The breakfast and staff there were nice too. Something for everyone. We could see fireworks from our room. The bathroom doors were awful. Who hangs barn doors with 1/2 inch gaps and no lock in a hotel room? Let’s light, smells, and noise in the room, disturbing those trying to sleep. Also let’s others, like toddlers,  into the bathroom who don’t respect privacy. The hotel is not as close to Disneyland as we thought. So we probably won’t stay there just for that reason alone. Mimi’s and McDonalds are in walking distance.

First and foremost, great location!  Rooms are new and spacious, small kitchen area, GREAT for families.  Restaurant was open yet, pool opened the day we checked out.  Waits at elevator were a planning consideration.  Only issue was the Check-in/Check-out/front desk.  Room wasn't ready at check in, valet is in a rush so it's hard to get ready to head to a theme park.  Have diamond status, requested and (verbally) received a 1- hour late check out to align with our car service pickup, wasn't honored, got back to our room to find door locked, huge line to get door unlocked making us late for our car pickup, which made the driver upset.

Stayed here on our trip to Disney. I had cancelled my original trip that had us at  a closer hotel to the Disney gates. When I rebooked this hotel was available. I was worried it might be a little bit of a walk but it wasn’t bad at all. My kids are 6 &8 and they didn’t find it too far. It’s about 10 min to the gates. We were very happy with our stay. Very clean spacious room that my kids liked. They enjoyed the pool. We had the breakfast which had a good offering. Staff was all very friendly. I would stay here again.

We loved our stay at the Home2 suites. We were welcomed with a smile and greeted kindly every day!  We were told about what to expect and the amenities of our stay. Those amenities didn’t disappoint.   We loved the pool. They are open everyday and the pool & splash pad are heated with plenty of space for families to enjoy.   The breakfast was great, well stocked and the dining room area was kept clean.   We also loved the gym. It was clean and had plenty of equipment.   The location is perfect for Disney and has easy access to a freeway!   The room was great. The hotel is new and clean. There was plenty of space for our family of 5. Having the kitchen, fridge and all the dresser space was perfect for our 7 night stay.   Our one big complaint and concern was the noise. We were on

My family of four stayed here over Valentine's weekend. Saturday thru Monday. We felt like the hotel was very clean and modern. It had everything we needed for our stay including breakfast. The staff was friendly and welcoming and the room ample enough for the four of us.  It is walking distance to Disney which is an added advantage to staying here. I dare say distance wise it's about the same distance as walking from the parking structure to the park entrance. The parking (valet) is $30 a night. The first day we arrived, we left our bags checked and walked over to the park (and back in the evening). There wasn't as much foot traffic as I expected in the evening back to the hotel (after parks closed/after midnight). Something to consider (safety wise) if you have very small

Property and lobby are beautiful and clean! Bar looked really nice but wasn’t able to visit. Quick walk to Disneyland and lots of restaurant options within walking distance as well. Loved the regular sized fridge in our room. Rooms were super spacious and comfortable. We slept well and staff was accommodating and friendly. We had a Disneyland view and got to see fireworks from the fifth floor which was amazing! Tip: Try to stop by one of the quick Marts (early on in your visit) by the hotels fronting Disneyland to stock up on water and snacks- much cheaper than the store at the hotel.

Read to me Lavish Detail. I feel like a lot of hotels close to Disney are kind of run down, but they keep getting rented out so they don’t renovate. This place is so clean and updated. Just stay when going to Disney

Hotel seems new but there are literally holes on the wall from construction. Room was either super cold or super hot. Breakfast was not good at all. No lactose options! Location to Disneyland was great but that is about it!
Manager Response: Thank for taking the time to share your feedback with us.  We are always looking for ways to improve our service and we will be taking your comments into consideration.  Thank you for staying with us and we hope that we can make it up to you on a future visit to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Not happy paid more for service that I never got
Summary: Never received stove to cook had to call multiple times for supplies and to get garbage out but no one came I had to take my own trash out and look for a housekeeper to get supplies to ask for things and give them my garbage so sad not to mention it’s been 2 days n haven’t seen my $100 deposit not sure why they are taking so long to release it  not happy at all
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your stay.  I apologize that we failed to meet your expectations.  I will be sharing your feedback with our Management Team to ensure that we address this and make sure it does not happen again.  Please be aware that the hotel does take a $50 per day security deposit.  Valet parking is deducted from this amount and can take 3 - 5 business days to release.  If you are still having any issues with your deposit, please contact the hotel for assistance.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for the Disney traveler
Summary: Great location, clean and free breakfast. Rooms are large!   Mandatory valet, so plan ahead. Don’t be a painful traveler with a mess in your vehicle, scrambling to pack as you park. (It only delays the staff and other travelers anxious to arrive)

Great place to stay when visiting Disneyland!  Rooms have plenty of space and the beds are comfortable! Complimentary breakfast was great.  Short walk to Disneyland and the price was excellent.  We'd stay there again.

Our stay was great!  This hotel was only about 7 minutes from the Disneyland and California Adventure theme parks.  It was very clean all throughout hotel, including room, eating areas , elevators, lobby and had really terrific service from each staff member that we interacted  with.  I would for sure stay here again and would recommend to family and friends!

I booked this place because I need it to bring my dog with me. H2S is within a walking distance to the entrance located at the opposite side of downtown Disney. Nevertheless, there are many restaurants available around the area.

Wonderful breakfast.  Clean hotel.  Friendly staff.  Within a comfortable walking distance to Disneyland.  I wish the bathroom door wasn’t a barn door and had a lock.  I also wish the water pressure was better on the 6th floor.  But you can see the fireworks from the top floor.

This hotel was a wonderful find!!!! Lobby was lovely and huge. The hotel was very clean and the staff was friendly and helpful.  It is 10 mins walk to Disneyland...very easy walk. Valet parking was a great help with parking and we didn't mind paying 25 per day for it. Breakfast was plentiful and included. Make sure to take some fruits and snacks into the park. Pod coffee was in the room which tasted great.   The room had plenty of space for two adults. Alot of storage spaces to put things.   We will be back again next time.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel and location to Disneyland, Clean and nice hot breakfast!
Summary: We stayed here the week before Christmas for a last minute trip to Disney. We had a room with 2 queen beds, a pull out sofa and a kitchen (no burner but you can borrow a portable burner from the front desk).  The rooms were good size, and service at front desk was great.  We arrived at the hotel at 9am and they held our luggage at a storage room, valet parked our car and went to the park. came back at 3pm and the room was ready.  There is a lot of shelves in the room for storage.  Kitchen came with a set of 5 plates, 6 bowls, mugs, silverware and glass cups.  Microwave, mini full size fridge with freezer and dishwasher.  There is no daily housekeeping but you can request trash pickup and towels.   Rooms were clean and well stocked.   Breakfast is located on the 2nd floor and has

Our experience was great, only thing I could say for improvements which doesn’t change my opinion cause we spent much majority of the stay at disneyland, would of been nice to know before we left home that we could of used the pool next door.

Super Clean hotel, clean hallways, clean bathrooms, clean lobby, clean elevator, multiple elevators super convenient. Nice and quiet. New clean beds, bed sheets. The rooms are huge!!! Kitchenette was super nice!!! Loved the Breakfast. Good breakfast options.  Breakfast area was super clean.

The hotel was in a great location for visitors who are going to Disneyland. It was a very easy walk to and from. The downside is if you get a room which is on the side of the freeway. We did and it made for a restless nights sleep for us and our frenchie.

I booked this room on Priceline.  The site stated that parking is free.  This is not the case.  You only offer valet parking at $25.00 per day plus tax.  When I notified the front desk if this issue, they were aware of the false information on Priceline and said it was up to me to argue with Priceline.  I think this is unacceptable.  Priceline is a broker for Hilton, and Hilton should correct this issue with Priceline, not the customer!!!  Hilton should honor their advertised rate.

New rooms, very clean and excellent staff! The beds were very comfortable and plenty of room for a family with two teens. Quick and tasty breakfast with a quick walk to parks. Front desk staff and housekeeping were so friendly. Will stay here again!

Summary Heading: Best family hotel ever! Super recommended.
Summary: Consistent above and beyond customer service and cleanliness. We stayed 12 nights due to health issues and home remodel and we always had smiles, welcoming, and amazing service. Our room was cleaned beautifully, anything we needed was brought quickly, A full kitchen, more than enough towels, comfortable beds and a quiet environment for my husband to rest as he recovered. The breakfast was great and the breakfast crew was the best as they made us feel that we were among friends. I have travelled quite a bit and this has been my best and most consistent excellent experience. I can’t wait to return!

Great stay, good welcome by the receptionist, good breakfast and great room. 8 mins by walk to Disneyland park. Just $25 for the vallet because there is no free parking so an additional cost not expected.

Decor simple but pleasant, could hear traffic and crying baby but overall safe and quaint. Increase communication regarding what’s available and not would be helpful. Also paying up front plus additional 50 per night felt annoying.

A must stay Hotel.  I really appreciate the staff’s Courtesy and respect.  Cleanest hotel in its category I have seen. Breakfast was always quality.  This place is just 10 min of walk from Disneyland.  I would highly recommend this Hotel.

Great location, new and clean hotel.  Friendly staff. Comfortable bed, cool ac, complimentary breakfast was okay, banana was still green, wish they had more healthy options like more fresh fruits, boiled eggs.  Fitness room was clean and new, however, some inconvenience, had to go to front desk to unlock the fitness room because of the key card was not working.

Summary Heading: Friendly Staff - Wonderful Location for Disneyland Stay
Summary: This hotel receives 5 stars for what it is - an economy hotel which caters to families going to Disneyland. It does not pretend to be anything more, but it doesn't need to be. Please be aware that this place is over run with kids. Ours included. Our room for 4 (parents + two kids) had two queen beds and a sofa sleeper. The stand alone fridge was more than adequate for our 4 night stay. There is also a full sized sink and dish washer. We had a room on the west side, which would have a Disneyland view if not for the multi-story hotel directly to the west. No view, but quiet and comfortable. (I was told on a phone call prior to the stay that there was no view, so I was not surprised.) Despite it's economy vibe, this hotel has a very nice fitness room. Lots of dumbbells and some

Restore housekeeping daily. This is a savings for corporate when they restrict this but the savings is not passed on to the consumer. Restore daily housekeeping .   This seems like a small issue but it is infuriating to one who travels regularly and stays for multiple days.

Excellent service, clean and quiet. Nice breakfast. Check in and out was super simple with app and Bluetooth.  Very easy walk to Disneyland. Front desk was very helpful. Only bummer pool and splash pad were down

Booked hotel based on Restaurant/lounge and pool. Neither were open and hotel didn’t advertise this at time of booking. Microwave was broken, AC didn’t work. Lots of lies. I would not recommend staying at this hotel when there are so many options available that are cheaper.

Located 11 minute walk from Disneyland. Good breakfast variety. Rooms clean, comfortable beds, lots of storage space. Friendly service. Quiet rooms. Only downside is paying for parking and multiple tax charges

Summary Heading: Great place to stay and close to Disney!
Summary: Hotel was clean and the rooms were in great condition. Very close walk to Disneyland made it super convenient for my family. The breakfast was decent, but I’m not staying in a hotel for a 4 star continental breakfast. Highly recommend!

My family really enjoyed this hotel and the breakfast options (hot breakfast sandwiches and fresh waffles) were pretty darn good.  The gym is well equipped and very spacious.  Overall, we had a very positive experience at this hotel and the walk to DL is not bad.

Summary Heading: Great property to stay for Disneyland!
Summary: While a bit further than other accommodations to Disneyland, it was still close enough, and the quality was a major notch up! It was clean and so comfortable, with a full kitchen suite inside. We even were able to see the Disneyland fireworks from our room (6th floor).

The hotel was beautiful to look at. My value would’ve been at its best had I been shown how to manage the AC, I just thought I turned on & placed temp, however there was other buttons I needed to push to not have it at over 50% humidity. I also was awaken to noisy children screaming & running plus a drilling sound or maybe the children were noisier than I thought. Also the room I got was great for my entire family (but they all canceled last minute) 2 beds to accommodate my 2 daughters & husbands, me & my youngest on sofa bed….HOWEVER please know the door to restroom leaves cracks at each end, making it possible for people at main door to see you on toilet & the other end exposes your naked self standing by tub where kitchen area is at, so anyone near sink can see you! I’d

Very close to Disneyland. Very short walk. Safe area. Loved how huge the room was. Excellent for big families. They have a little store in the lobby. Full of snacks, toiletries,any last minute things you can use on a trip.

Summary Heading: Nice new hotel just behind Disney
Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights with my family of 5 and was pleasantly surprised to find a modern and well appointed Home2Suites attached to a Hilton Garden Inn.  They in fact share the same building and I believe are only separated by room numbers and no physical barrier per se.  Parking was valet only and worked fairly well.    The breakfast offering was fairly standard with some hot, pre-packaged items available.  On one occasion the food was not heated enough and were still cold when we took them to our table.  Nice big laundry room.  Can't speak to the pool as it had not been completed yet.  My only gripe is that you have to walk all the way around to get to Harbor Blvd as opposed to there being some sort of short cut behind the hotel.  Adds a few minutes to your walk to and from

Loved the beds, so comfy! Loved having a kitchen! Reasonable walking distance to Disney! Hot buffet style breakfast was nice! Only downside was the rooms where the ice machine and water would be were still being worked on and only water we could locate was on the ground floor and didn’t taste great. Other than that it was a great stay!

This was a great stay for us for our Disney trip. I wish I would have know that the hotel was the closer option than parking in Disney’s lot (my mother in law recently had knee replacement and didn’t expect to walk far). We were rather disappointed that Disney didn’t have their trams shuttling people to the park from the parking structure so it was a farther walk than it would have been from the hotel. Overall, the hotel was awesome and very clean. It was in a nice location and the staff was very friendly. We will be back again!

New nice hotel staff friendly and helpful. Rooms clean and hotel enforced COVID policies to protect guest. Downside valet parking broke side car mirror during our stay. Staff immediately filed report and handled situation appropriately

Summary Heading: Nice stay but check to see if perks are available
Summary: Brand new with Beautiful, clean rooms. Staff very friendly. But a lot of what is offered on the app and website is not available. Pool not open, no late check out for AARP members, bar closed, limited offerings at walk up food area, snacks and drinks are very expensive. Had problems with digital and regular key accessing the breakfast room. It’s about a 15 min walk to Disneyland.

This hotel was super clean easy to find with large rooms. The staff was very polite.  The only draw back was parking is valet only and no where on their website or Hilton .com mentioned there was a 22 dollar parking fee. For parking your car.

In room 321, shower door will not stay shut. It opens right by the shower head, which means someone either needs to continually shut the door or accept that they will be making a large puddle in the bathroom.

Hotel was awesome great staff about a 10 min walk 5 min drive to Disney room was awesome full kitchen comfy beds i would say I will def be making this my go to hotel when im in town couldnt ask for a better stay

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland!  We'll be back!
Summary: Just stayed for 4 days.  Pool is still closed but the hotel is brand new.  The rooms are quite spacious!  We had connecting rooms for a total of 4 queens and 2 couch beds with 2 bathrooms for our family.  This worked great!  Everything is brand new--even the towels!  It was great to see 6 towels in our bathroom each time.  Usually you have to go and ask for more with our family.  Good size fridge for drinks and leftovers.  Breakfast is great with breakfast sandwiches, omelets, waffles, cereal, oatmeal and yogurt.  If you head back to the hotel in the afternoon to cool off there's McDonalds, Panera bread, Tony Romas, and Mimis to take advantage of and save some money from Disney prices.  Be sure to get the map from the front desk that has coupons for the restaurants.  Yes it's

Great location and great accommodations!! Incredible staff that work at this location. This is a great place for families to stay. The room are spacious and the amenities that this hotel offers are great.

This hotel is new, clean, spacious and walking distance to Disneyland Resort. I highly recommend - especially for families. The kitchens in the suites are awesome - better than any other suite hotels where I’ve stayed in the past. The beds were comfortable and perfect to crash in after a long day at Disney.

Everything was good we were able to see fireworks from our room which was amazing! The pool was closed due to remodeling though so we couldn’t go swimming and couldn’t cancel either. Valet is $22+tax which isn’t bad. They were very fast at getting our cars.

This hotel is very close to Disneyland (walkable distance) and rooms have a kitchenette - exactly what I was looking for. I have a picky eater and I was able to have food for her in our room. There was a fridge that included a freezer, microwave oven, toaster, coffee maker and they can provide portable cooktops upon request for no additional charge. The room was very spacious as well as the bathroom and the beds very comfortable. I also enjoyed the complimentary breakfast: oatmeal, self made waffles, yogurt, fruit, juice, coffee…. way more options than I expected. Overall great experience.

We loved staying here! Hotel was very clean. Rooms were spacious. Staff were friendly and extremely helpful, no matter time of day or night. They provided us with maps and suggestions/locations of close-by businesses . They even have suggested walking shortcuts to the park. We were able to swim in the next door hotels pool since ours wasn’t yet ready. Quick 10 minute walk to park even with three generation families!

The team at Homesuites are dong a great job .  Julia, Hector, Martha , Dulce provided us with. Great breakfast service, Julia’s smile gives me positive energy  I love it & I will come back .  Thank you all ,

It's as far of a walk to the main gates as from the Disneyland Hotel, which, even with my corporate discount was still about $100 more per night.  Clean, NEW, but no pool (we didn't mind!) great staff!

Customer service was excellent, walking distance to Disneyland/ California Adventure. Continental Breakfast was great. Kids were able to use the swimming pool next door during our downtime while relaxing. Valet parking ONLY; however, it was convenient. You do need to give plenty of time to allow for your car to be brought to you, so be mindful of that.

Brand new property with great amenities.  Rooms well-designed and very comfortable.  Pretty good free breakfast is a huge plus.  By and large staff was friendly, welcoming and responsive.  Only drawbacks were that the pool wasn’t finished, and only valet parking is available.  Would much prefer a self-parking option, even though valets were very good.

Summary Heading: Room was nice, but valet parking was a nightmare
Summary: Room was nice. No swimming pool on site.  I was charged for 2 valet parking per day, while I had only ONE car. When I tried to address this problem after my stay, they were unwilling to offer help to correct or investigate the issue until much further debate.

Hotel is too busy to operate. Prepare for long waits and lack of communication.   Was told room would be ready at check in. It was not. Informed I would receive a call when ready. I was not.   Used valet instructions as directed. Was replied back 20 min later stating Unfortunately, no valets are available to retrieve your vehicle at this time. Please try again in 10 minutes or present your ticket to the valet stand.   So I had to present my ticket and wait another 15-20 min.

We loved this new hotel. The location was perfect. Extremely convenient for our trip to Disneyland. Some of the amenities were not ready yet, but we still enjoyed what they had. The valet parking was a bit of a surprise.

Summary Heading: Perfect Place to stay for your Disney Trip
Summary: Enjoyed our two night stay here during our recent Disneyland trip! Recently renovated so everything is new. The rooms are clean and large. The in room kitchenette has everything you need. Breakfast was included- waffle maker, bagels, cereal, hot breakfast sandwiches and more. The best part is that this hotel is just a quick 10min walk to the parks!! I highly recommend!

The hotel was new and very clean.  Everyone we encountered had great customer service and made us feel welcome!  It was valet parking only but we did not have a car.  It was only a half mile walk to Disneyland.  The breakfast buffet was great and was kept full and very clean.

My family and I had the best experience here. We stayed for one night and felt welcome as soon as we walked in and was greeted by the host. Our room was completely spotless and sanitized. The complimentary breakfast was served in to go boxes which made it very conscientious and safe. I will most definitely be coming back with my family.

The staff was great and the facility and rooms were clean.  The fitness room was great for a hotel.  The proximity to Disneyland was great and within walking distance.  My rating wasn't higher because of the following.  1.  The pool and kid's water play area was undergoing renovation.  2.  The restaurants weren't open.  3. The breakfast buffet was a grab and go but was essentially the same item for multiple days and they didn't have milk, which my kids complained about.  Now 2 & 3 are likely due to COVID, so I definitely would consider staying here again.

Summary Heading: Not quite ready for prime time
Summary: this hotel will be a gem when it is completely finished. Right now the pool has not been filled, the restaurant and breakfast area is under construction, and the two bedroom suite I ordered online was not ready so it was replaced by two studio rooms and I was not charged for the original two bedroom suite. The rooms were brand new-- one room we had was facing the I-5 highway and you had to strain to hear any road noise. The rooms facing away from the highway had a partial view of the fireworks at Disneyland. There are no tub mats so consider bringing your own. The refrigerators were the biggest I have ever seen in a hotel. You could fit a frozen pizza in the freezer even though you couldn't cook it in the microwave. The kitchen was well equipped and The toaster is in the bottom

Summary Heading: Great location but not fully operational
Summary: I will preface this review by singing the praises of Sam, a the front desk, and the rest of the hotel staff. I will not go into the nitty gritty of the issues we encountered during our first vacation out of quarantine, but let's just say, I wish Hilton Management had laid a disclaimer (and they should!!) that this hotel is a brand-new build and not at full operating capacity.  My family and our friends booked our Disneyland/Universal trip back early May and reserved this hotel. Not knowing until two weeks before our arrival that this hotel was not fully operational (I was only alerted after reading a recent review). When I called the hotel to inquire about the state of affairs, I was met with an elitist attitude and told that the onus was on me to find out and ask the right

Beautiful brand new hotel with clean big rooms.  Very comfy bed and quiet hallways.  It was great to be able to walk to Disney, just 15 minutes away.  Restaurant and pool was still under construction but they provided breakfast on to go boxes which was perfect for us!
